newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile to privatize copper company Enami -- report.
newsitem.headline: Chile to privatize copper company Enami -- report.

text.p: Chile is planning to sell state copper company Enami's two smelting and refining complexes and two other smaller copper production plants, El Diario reported Monday.

The newspaper said a government report, written by a commission including representatives from Enami and the finance and economy ministries, recommended the sale as a solution to paying off the company's large debts.
Officials from Enami were not immediately available for comment.
The government plans to authorize the sale by decree which would avoid debate over the privatization in Congress, said the newspaper.

Enami's operations include the Paipote smelter, with a processing capacity of 260,000 tonnes of concentrates a year, and the Ventanas smelter and refinery which treats 330,000 tonnes of copper a year.
The company has invested heavily recent years in environment projects at the plants which are among the worst industrial polluters in Chile.
